edu.spa.ftclib.internal.drivetrain

Interface Headingable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Rotatable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HeadingableMecanumDrivetrain, HeadingableOmniwheelDrivetrain, HeadingableTankDrivetrain

    public interface Headingable
extends Rotatable
    Created by Gabriel on 2017-12-27. A drivetrain whose heading it is possible to set (presumably using a gyro or some other sensor). We couldn't think of a better name for this interface. Extends Rotatable, because all drivetrains with settable headings must be rotatable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finishRotating()
      If there are any settings (motor RunModes, etc.) you changed to rotate, change them back in this method.
      double getCurrentHeading()
      Get the current heading of the drivetrain (presumably a value from a sensor and not necessarily the drivetrain's target heading).
      double getTargetHeading()
      Get the target heading of the drivetrain (not necessarily the actual, current heading of the drivetrain), passed in using setTargetHeading(double).
      boolean isRotating()
      Use this as a loop condition (with {@link #updateHeading in the loop body) if you want to turn to a specific heading and then move on to other code.
      void rotate() 
      void setTargetHeading(double targetHeading)
      Set the target heading of the drivetrain.
      void updateHeading()
      Recalculate motor powers to maintain or move towards the target heading

      • Methods inherited from interface edu.spa.ftclib.internal.drivetrain.Rotatable

        getRotation, setRotation

    • Method Detail

      • setTargetHeading

        void setTargetHeading(double targetHeading)
        Set the target heading of the drivetrain.
        Parameters:
        targetHeading - the angle that you want the drivetrain to move towards

      • getCurrentHeading

        double getCurrentHeading()
        Get the current heading of the drivetrain (presumably a value from a sensor and not necessarily the drivetrain's target heading).
        Returns:
        the angle the drivetrain is currently facing

      • getTargetHeading

        double getTargetHeading()
        Get the target heading of the drivetrain (not necessarily the actual, current heading of the drivetrain), passed in using setTargetHeading(double).
        Returns:
        the heading that the robot is currently trying to get to or move along.

      • updateHeading

        void updateHeading()
        Recalculate motor powers to maintain or move towards the target heading

      • rotate

        void rotate()

      • isRotating

        boolean isRotating()
        Use this as a loop condition (with {@link #updateHeading in the loop body) if you want to turn to a specific heading and then move on to other code.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the drivetrain is still rotating towards the target heading

      • finishRotating

        void finishRotating()
        If there are any settings (motor RunModes, etc.) you changed to rotate, change them back in this method.
